timeline.bodyText:
To deal with the @NonNullByDefault warnings you can do one of three things:

Add the @NonNullByDefault to the class.
Make sure that your class name ends in DTO
Make sure that your class is in a package or subpackage called dto.

Please do one of the three.

replies.bodyText: This class is used to map the result of a hue API JSON result. That's why it does not have @NonNullByDefault like all other classes of this kind in this binding (and most of other bindings).
replies.author: lolodomo

timeline.bodyText: Why are you using parallelStream here? How large is the scene list expected to be? If it is less than 100 then just use a regular stream instead.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText:
It was @leluna initial choice.
Yes, I think it will be generally less than 100, except if you have defined a very big number of rooms in your home or you created a lot of hue scenes.
